sections.title: I am the Lord your God; you shall not have strange gods before me

questions.text: Have I placed ministry or reputation above my relationship with God?
Have I trusted my efforts more than God's grace?
Have I given God the first place in my heart daily?
Have I allowed prayer to become routine or rushed?
Have I taught the faithful to worship God above all?
Have I honored my priestly identity as a gift from God?
Have I relied on the Holy Spirit rather than personal strength?

sections.title: You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain

questions.text: Have I used God's name casually or without reverence?
Have I spoken about sacred things flippantly or jokingly?
Have I upheld the holiness of the liturgy and sacraments?
Have I prayed with attention and not out of habit alone?
Have I promoted reverence for God’s name among the faithful?
Have I taken oaths or vows lightly?
Have I spoken respectfully of God's actions in people's lives?

sections.title: Remember to keep holy the Lord’s Day

questions.text: Have I celebrated the Mass with full attention and devotion?
Have I prepared well for preaching on Sundays?
Have I encouraged my parishioners to honor Sunday as sacred?
Have I refrained from unnecessary work or distractions on the Lord’s Day?
Have I helped others encounter Christ on Sundays?
Have I allowed Sunday to be a true day of worship and rest?
Have I expressed gratitude to God in my heart each Sabbath?

sections.title: Honor your father and your mother

questions.text: Have I shown love and gratitude for my parents and family?
Have I prayed for and supported my bishop and Church leaders?
Have I respected and obeyed the legitimate authority of the Church?
Have I modeled humility and cooperation in clerical life?
Have I shown gratitude for those who formed me?
Have I honored my spiritual ancestors and their wisdom?
Have I encouraged others to live in reverence for authority?
Have I wounded others through harsh criticism or neglect?
Have I hurt someone's faith through my words or actions?
Have I forgiven those who have wronged me in ministry?
Have I fostered healing and reconciliation in my parish?
Have I protected the dignity of every human life?
Have I addressed injustice with courage and charity?
Have I examined my heart for anger, envy, or bitterness?
Have I remained faithful to my promise of celibacy in mind and body?
Have I maintained appropriate boundaries with others?
Have I watched, read, or listened to anything impure?
Have I protected the faithful by teaching and modeling chastity?
Have I allowed impure thoughts or relationships to grow unchecked?
Have I turned to prayer and confession for purity of heart?
Have I honored the sacredness of the priestly vocation in my body?
Have I been responsible with parish or Church resources?
Have I used time and money in service of the Gospel?
Have I respected others’ time, boundaries, and possessions?
Have I been transparent and accountable with finances?
Have I modeled generosity for the faithful?
Have I used Church property solely for the mission of the Church?
Have I sought detachment from material things?

sections.title: You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor

questions.text: Have I spoken truthfully and charitably about others?
Have I guarded confidences entrusted to me in ministry?
Have I avoided gossip or divisive speech?
Have I defended the reputation of others when appropriate?
Have I been honest in preaching and spiritual direction?
Have I asked forgiveness for any words that hurt others?
Have I witnessed to the truth of Christ in all conversations?

sections.title: You shall not covet your neighbor’s wife

questions.text: Have I been envious of others’ relationships or affections?
Have I entertained emotional attachments that distract from my call?
Have I been fully devoted to Christ, my true spouse?
Have I respected others’ marriages and vocations?
Have I resisted temptations of comparison or longing?
Have I found satisfaction in God alone?
Have I supported married couples with purity of heart?

sections.title: You shall not covet your neighbor’s goods

questions.text: Have I compared my ministry, parish, or gifts with others’?
Have I allowed jealousy to creep into my view of fellow priests?
Have I rejoiced in others’ blessings without envy?
Have I thanked God for my portion and calling?
Have I been content with what I have been given?
Have I avoided materialism or status-seeking?
Have I promoted simplicity and gratitude in parish life?
